meanings.definition: The imitation or evocation of Chinese motifs and techniques in Western art, furniture, and architecture.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with chinoiserie, from the delicate porcelain vases to the intricate silk tapestries.
meanings.sent2: She admired the chinoiserie on display at the museum, marveling at the intricate designs and vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The chinoiserie dragon on the teapot seemed to come alive, playfully blowing steam from its nostrils.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a blend of Western realism and chinoiserie fantasy, creating a unique and captivating style.
meanings.sent5: The chinoiserie garden was a masterpiece of cultural fusion, with pagodas peeking through lush greenery.

meanings.definition: Objects or decorations in the Chinese style.
meanings.sent1: The antique shop was a treasure trove of chinoiserie, with ornate screens and delicate figurines.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant was adorned with elegant chinoiserie, transporting diners to a world of oriental charm.
meanings.sent3: She playfully arranged the chinoiserie figurines on the mantelpiece, creating a whimsical scene.
meanings.sent4: The chinoiserie lanterns cast a warm glow, adding a touch of exotic allure to the room.
meanings.sent5: The chinoiserie fans fluttered in the breeze, their intricate patterns mesmerizing all who passed by.
